section.section: There is a Vehicle Theft Prevention Council in the Department.

The purpose of the Council is to help prevent and deter theft of private passenger and commercial motor vehicles and related crime, including vandalism and theft of property from vehicles, in the State.

The Council consists of the following 13 members appointed by the Governor:
as ex officio members of the Council:
the Secretary or a designee;
the Secretary of Juvenile Services or a designee;
the Secretary of Public Safety and Correctional Services or a designee; and
the Motor Vehicle Administrator of the Motor Vehicle Administration; and
nine regular members.
The members serve at the pleasure of the Governor.
The term of a regular member is 3 years.
The terms of the regular members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Council on October 1, 2003.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: The Governor shall appoint the Chairman of the Council.

A member of the Council:
may not receive compensation as a member of the Council; but
is entitled to reimbursement for expenses from the Fund in accordance with the Standard State Travel Regulations.

section.section: The Council shall employ an executive director, who shall be appointed by the Governor.
The expenses of the Council, including staff salaries and administrative expenses, shall be paid from the Fund but may not exceed 7% of the total expenditures from the Fund in a fiscal year.
The Assistant Attorney General assigned to the Department is the legal advisor to the Council.
The Council shall develop and implement a plan of operation.
